thread.title: Report: Coach to be fired after Saturday's game
thread.title_full: Report: Coach to be fired after Saturday's game

title: Report: Coach to be fired after Saturday's game
text:
Posted: 2:07 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 Report: Coach to be fired after Saturday's game David Jablonski/Staff Maryland coach Randy Edsall speaks at a press conference on Thursday, July 30, 2015, at Big Ten Media Days in Chicago. David Jablonski/Staff By Justin Boggs Staff Writer 
As No. 1 Ohio State is ready to welcome Maryland as its homecoming guest Saturday, Maryland's athletics department is considering dismissing coach Randy Edsall according to reports. 
InsideMDSports is reporting that Edsall, a 57-year-old who is in his fifth year at Maryland, will be released from his contract following this Saturday's contest at Ohio State. The Terrapins have started the season 2-3 after last week's 28-0 loss at Michigan. 
On June 30, Kevin Anderson, Maryland's director of athletics, announced the university was extending Edsall's contract through 2019. 
Edsall led Maryland through its transition from the Atlantic Coast Conference to the Big Ten. Since Edsall was hired, Maryland has gone 22-33, with only two apperances in bowl games. Maryland lost both contests. 
Ohio State won last year's meeting 52-24 in the first contest between the two teams as conference foes. 
Despite the Buckeyes' offense struggling in recent games, Ohio State is a 33-point favorite at home versus Maryland. Ohio State has not beaten Vegas' spread the last four games. More News
